item.title:
@tomhostler @ucu I think it's vital that #openresearch initiatives are built with workloads in mind & should ideally save academics time. A good rule of thumb is that for every minute of extra time your great idea costs, it should try & save 2 minutes.
It's not always possible, but we must try.
item.description:
@tomhostler @ucu I think it's vital that #openresearch initiatives are built with workloads in mind & should ideally save academics time. A good rule of thumb is that for every minute of extra time your great idea costs, it should try & save 2 minutes.

A good rule of thumb is that for every minute of extra time your great idea costs, it should try & save 2 minutes. It's not always possible, but we must try.

item.title:
For example when we launched the TOP guidelines at Cortex back in 2018, we added a checklist to the submission process that takes about 15 min to complete if filled in correctly.
So we also cut at least an hour of bureaucracy from the rest of the submission process.

item.title: Recognising the workload costs associated with Stage 1 review time for Registered Reports, at @PCI_RegReports we introduced two hopefully time-saving features.
item.description: Recognising the workload costs associated with Stage 1 review time for Registered Reports, at @PCI_RegReports we introduced two hopefully time-saving features.
item.content:encoded: Recognising the workload costs associated with Stage 1 review time for Registered Reports, at @PCI_RegReports we introduced two hopefully time-saving features.

item.title:
The 1st is scheduled review where key parts of the reivew process are parallelised to plan review for the future. This aims to not only make review faster but also organise it more efficiently for authors and reviewers (keeping workloads in mind)
https://t.co/DKLjZSgkP8 https://t.co/t0baijMJKg
item.description:
The 1st is scheduled review where key parts of the reivew process are parallelised to plan review for the future. This aims to not only make review faster but also organise it more efficiently for authors and reviewers (keeping workloads in mind)
https://t.co/DKLjZSgkP8 https://t.co/t0baijMJKg
item.content:encoded: The 1st is scheduled review where key parts of the reivew process are parallelised to plan review for the future. This aims to not only make review faster but also organise it more efficiently for authors and reviewers (keeping workloads in mind) https://t.co/DKLjZSgkP8 https://t.co/t0baijMJKg

item.title:
The 2nd is the programmatic track in which one Stage 1 submission can include multiple studies & produce multiple Stage 2 published outputs. This avoids unnecessary duplication of pre-study evaluation and aims to reduce workloads for authors & reviewers.
https://t.co/UcQO7X6qa2

item.title:
